newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's maquiladora jobs rise 20.1 pct in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's maquiladora jobs rise 20.1 pct in Sept.

text.p: Employment in Mexico's maquiladora export industry grew 20.1 percent in September, compared to the same month last year, the National Statistics Institute (INEGI) said Wednesday in a news release.
Employment has risen an accumulated 16.4 percent over the first nine months of this year, INEGI said.

The statistics institute said in a monthly report that the industry, comprised of assembly plants mostly along the U.S. border, employed 788,205 people in September, up from 656,281 in the same month last year.
In the January-September period, 82.2 percent of maquiladora plants were located in the northern states of Chihuahua, Baja California, Tamaulipas, Coahuila and Sonora.
From January to September of this year, the industry generated export value added of 34.414 billion pesos.
